qas.question: What is green a symbol of in China?
In the Middle Ages, which color was associated with merchants, bankers, and the gentry?
What does the Mona Lisa wearing green symbolize?

answers.text: she is not from a noble family

qas.question: What does the color green represent in the flags of Islamic countries?
Why is green the color of the environmental movement?
Red is associated with what religion?
What color did the nobility in China wear?
What color shows that Mona Lisa is a noble?
What does a red light indicate?
Besides happiness, what contradictory meaning does China ascribe to green?

context: In surveys made in Europe and the United States, green is the color most commonly associated with nature, life, health, youth, spring, hope and envy. In Europe and the U.S. green is sometimes associated with <b9_0>death<b9_0/> (green has several seemingly contrary associations), sickness, or the devil, but in China its associations are very positive, as the symbol of <a0_0>fertility and happiness<a0_0/>. In the Middle Ages and Renaissance, when the color of clothing showed the owner's social status, <a1_0>green<a1_0/> was worn by merchants, bankers and the gentry, while <b6_0>red<b6_0/> was the color of the nobility. The Mona Lisa by Leonardo da Vinci wears <b7_0>green<b7_0/>, showing <a2_0>she is not from a noble family<a2_0/>; the benches in the British House of Commons are green, while those in the House of Lords are red. Green is also the traditional color of safety and permission; a green light means <b8_0>go ahead<b8_0/>, a green card permits permanent residence in the United States. It is the most important color in <b5_0>Islam<b5_0/>. It was the color of the banner of Muhammad, and is found in the flags of nearly all Islamic countries, and represents the <a3_0>lush vegetation of Paradise<a3_0/>. It is also often associated with the culture of Gaelic Ireland, and is a color of the flag of Ireland. Because of <a4_0>its association with nature<a4_0/>, it is the color of the environmental movement. Political groups advocating environmental protection and social justice describe themselves as part of the Green movement, some naming themselves Green parties. This has led to similar campaigns in advertising, as companies have sold green, or environmentally friendly, products.
